Key Arguments: The legislation assumes a single objective truth, which contradicts the subjective truth systems favored by the government.
Science is inherently open to debate and falsification, making censorship based on 'fixed' science problematic.
The government itself is a major source of misinformation and disinformation, particularly regarding COVID-19 and the 2020 US election.
Censorship is anti-democratic and undermines free speech, which is foundational to democracy.
Main Themes: Conflict between objective and subjective truth systems
Government as a source of misinformation
Censorship as a threat to democracy and free speech
Notable Quotes: There is a glaring hypocrisy in a government holding two irreconcilable systems of truth together.
Any government that wishes to censor on the basis of a fixed and unchanging science has to explain why centuries of philosophy has warned of its achilles heel.
Over the last three years Western governments have provided irrefutable evidence demonstrating that they indeed are the most guilty of peddling misinformation and disinformation.
Censorship is not about truth but is rather the plaything of the powerful to silence dissent and political diversity.
